STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 20, 2023
Mary Jo French
MUSKEGON COUNTY JUVENILE TRANSITION CENTER
205 E APPLE AVE,
MUSKEGON, MI, 49442-3406
Re: License #: CO610385814
Dear Ms. French:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/15/2023. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant spoke with Chief Administrator about the challenges of getting a
consistent dental provider for the youth. Consultant gave the technical
assistance to make sure they are documenting all attempts to get the dental

appointments scheduled and noting any cancelations, reschedules, and youth
refusals within their medical records.
• The facility recently had a change in nursing. Ensure all the immunizations
records are noted to be within the medical record of the youth.
• Consultant provided the feedback from staff interviews that staff have been
frustrated with some of the rule changes and making sure youth expectations
are clear to everyone. Staff have reported frustrations that one staff member
will put a youth on restriction and the next shift will not follow through with that
expectation. Chief Administrator plans to address that at the upcoming team
meeting.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The behavior management room has not been in use and the facility recently had
the blueprint plans approved by the fire bureau for renovations. The chief
administrator plans to keep the consultant updated about the plans for the room,
construction, and updated policies. A change application will be submitted once
the team creates the policy for the room so that it will be able to be added to the
license.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they enjoy
their jobs. They reported feeling an adequate amount of training and were well
versed in the restraint model training. The staff indicated restraints rarely occur at
the facility and noted no concerns of the ones that they observed or participated in.

Some staff reported frustration with some of the rule changes and making sure
youth expectations are clear to everyone. Staff have reported frustrations that one
staff member will put a youth on restriction and the next shift will not follow through
with that expectation. This was addressed with administration.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection and reported feeling safe at
the facility. They all reported that they have staff members that make them feel
supportive and make progress within their goals. The youth indicated no concerns
with restraints that have observed or be in. They all reported staff rarely complete
a restraint unless there is a physical altercation. The youth reported they enjoy the
level system and the privileges they earn. One youth requested that the higher
level should be provided more privileges such as more treats, this information was
provided to the administrative team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on June 15, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
June 16, 2023
___________________________________________
Cathrine Raftery Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 20, 2023
